questions.question: She is intelligent __ hardworking.
questions.explanation: 'And' is used to connect similar qualities or ideas.

questions.question: He is __ talented __ dedicated to his work.
questions.explanation: 'Both - and' is used to emphasize two qualities.

questions.question: The teacher, __ the students, enjoyed the trip.
questions.explanation: 'As well as' is used to add extra information.

questions.question: She is __ a great singer __ a talented dancer.
questions.explanation: 'Not only - but also' is used for emphasis when listing qualities.

questions.question: He was tired, __ he continued working.
questions.explanation: 'But' is used to contrast two ideas.

questions.question: I wanted to help, __ I was too busy.
questions.explanation: 'Only' is used to limit the possibility of something.

questions.question: She is __ intelligent __ wise.
questions.explanation: 'Neither - nor' is used to show negative choices.

questions.question: You can __ go by train __ take a flight.
questions.explanation: 'Either - or' is used to show two choices.

questions.question: Hurry up, __ you will miss the bus.
questions.explanation: 'Else' is used for alternatives or consequences.

questions.question: We must act now; __, it will be too late.
questions.explanation: 'Otherwise' is used to show what will happen if something is not done.

questions.question: He studied hard, __ he failed the exam.
questions.explanation: 'Yet' is used to contrast unexpected results.

questions.question: She wanted to go out; __, it was raining heavily.
questions.explanation: 'However' is used to introduce a contrasting idea.

questions.question: It was getting late, __ we decided to leave.
questions.explanation: 'So' is used to indicate a result.

questions.question: I was hungry, __ I ate a sandwich.
questions.explanation: 'For' is used to explain reasons.

questions.question: He had no money; __, he couldn't buy the ticket.
questions.explanation: 'Hence' is used to indicate a result.

questions.question: The weather was bad; __, the match was postponed.
questions.explanation: 'Therefore' is used to show a logical result.

questions.question: She was tired; __, she kept working.
questions.explanation: 'Still' is used to show persistence despite difficulty.

questions.question: She ran __ fast __ she could.
questions.explanation: 'So - that' is used to show the degree of an action.

questions.question: He is __ intelligent __ his brother.
questions.explanation: 'As - as' is used for comparisons of equality.

questions.question: __ she entered the room, everyone became silent.
questions.explanation: 'As soon as' is used to show immediate action.

questions.question: He had __ left __ the guests arrived.
questions.explanation: 'No sooner - than' is used for past events occurring one after another.

questions.question: I waited __ you returned.
questions.explanation: 'Till' is used to indicate waiting until a certain time.

questions.question: She didn't go outside __ it was raining.
questions.explanation: 'Because' is used to give a reason.

questions.question: We stayed indoors __ it was stormy outside.
questions.explanation: 'Since' is used to indicate a reason.

questions.question: Work hard __ you should fail.
questions.explanation: 'Lest' is used to express a warning or negative consequence.

questions.question: Study well __ you can pass the exam.
questions.explanation: 'So that' is used to express purpose.

questions.question: I will go __ you call me.
questions.explanation: 'If' is used for conditional situations.

questions.question: She is not as tall __ her sister.
questions.explanation: 'As - as' is used for comparisons of equality.

questions.question: __ you work hard, you will succeed.
questions.explanation: 'If' is used to express conditions.

questions.question: She will not go __ she is invited.
questions.explanation: 'Unless' is used for negative conditions.

questions.question: He helped me __ he was kind.
questions.explanation: 'Because' is used to indicate the reason.

questions.question: I will finish the work __ I leave.
questions.explanation: 'Before' is used to show a sequence of events.

questions.question: This is the place __ we met last year.
questions.explanation: 'Where' is used to refer to a location.

questions.question: The girl __ won the race is my sister.
questions.explanation: 'Who' is used for subjects in relative clauses.

questions.question: This is the book __ I borrowed from you.
questions.explanation: 'Which' is used for objects in relative clauses.

questions.question: The boy __ bicycle was stolen is crying.
questions.explanation: 'Whose' is used to show possession.

questions.question: This is the man __ I met yesterday.
questions.explanation: 'Whom' is used for objects in relative clauses.
